meanings.sent1: The bread staled quickly in the hot sun.
meanings.sent2: Leaving the cookies out made them staled and unappetizing.
meanings.sent3: The forgotten fruit staled in the bowl, turning brown and wrinkled.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for the project staled over time, like a wilting flower.
meanings.sent5: The once vibrant flowers staled and wilted in the neglected garden.

meanings.definition: make or become out-of-date or obsolete
meanings.sent1: The technology staled as newer models were released.
meanings.sent2: The fashion trend quickly staled and was replaced by a new style.
meanings.sent3: His jokes staled with repetition, losing their humor over time.
meanings.sent4: The once popular song staled with age, no longer resonating with listeners.
meanings.sent5: The information in the textbook staled as new discoveries were made in the field.
